intro: Tephrosia aequilata var. meyeri-johannis, commonly known as the Meyer-Johannis tephrosia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant typically features slender stems and small, delicate flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. It is often found in moist, well-drained soils and can thrive in shaded or semi-shaded environments. This species is valued for its ornamental appeal and potential use in traditional medicine.
